stream_context.summary: Kaze live-edited the overworld and cave for Return to Yoshi’s Island, finishing a first-pass on the first four overworld segments, revisiting a forgotten crystal-based star idea, and opening public applications for casual beta testers while discussing project progress, finances, and personal issues.

development_findings.summary: Overworld progress estimated at roughly 28-30 %; Course 6 about 10 %.
development_findings.quote: I would say overworld 28 % and… course 6 10 %.

development_findings.summary: Game could technically release now, but Kaze intends to keep polishing with no fixed limit.
development_findings.quote: We're almost in a state where we would be able to just release the game, but there is still some polishing I want to do.

development_findings.summary: Public Google Form opened for beta-test applications; testers are asked to play casually for gameplay feedback rather than formal bug hunting.
development_findings.quote: The beta testing here is literally just you casually playing the game. Be warned though that this is obviously an early version.

development_findings.summary: Kaze avoids recruiting testers through Patreon to reduce legal risk.
development_findings.quote: I don't want to get into any legal trouble here, so I don't want to look for testers on Patreon.

development_findings.summary: Design decision for cave star: carrying a crystal makes a hidden path appear around Mario; may involve multiple crystals across platforms.
development_findings.quote: There would be a crystal here and while you hold the crystal a path around Mario appears and you can only interact with the path while you are holding the crystal.

development_findings.summary: Level-design fix: falling into cave water is currently too punishing; plan to add a chain of small platforms to aid recovery.
development_findings.quote: How do I make falling in here suck less? … How about a bunch of tiny platforms that you can jump on to get back to the beginning.

development_findings.summary: First pass on the first four overworld parts is complete; there are 14 parts in total and warps still need to be set.
development_findings.quote: I think that is the first pass for the first four overworlds done … now we have all the overworlds up to bazaar one. We should set warps here.

development_findings.summary: Visual rework underway: salt area lighting must be darkened; dirt texture unsatisfactory; overall overworld textures expected to be replaced once Biobak’s updates are integrated.
Project milestone tracker on Trello/Notion is out-of-date; Kaze notes it shows 75 % for course work but needs revision.

context_findings.summary: Needs increased YouTube output to support family; Squarespace pays $2,500 flat per sponsored video and enables video production.
context_findings.quote: I would not have made a single one of those videos if Squarespace didn't pay me.

context_findings.summary: Ongoing tax anxiety: German tax office (Finanzamt) owes him money; communication with his German accountant has broken down since moving to Canada.
context_findings.quote: I think I did everything right but I have no proof for it… the guy doesn't write me back.

context_findings.summary: Living in Canada; finds local bug bites worse than in Germany.
context_findings.quote: The bug bites in Canada are so much worse than in Germany… it bleeds.

context_findings.summary: Long-term plan to migrate from Windows to Linux once Windows 10 support ends.
Philosophy on discourse: values arguments where parties admit when wrong; sees this as rare and important.
context_findings.quote: We had a disagreement, and in the end one party admitted they were wrong… that's a talent.

biobak.summary: Finished Course 2 visuals and is reworking Course 3 textures; expected to update the public progress tracker.
biobak.quote: I think Biobak also finished Course 2… he said he would update the progress tracker.

biobak.summary: Kaze relies on Biobak’s memory for earlier design ideas, including the crystal path star.
biobak.quote: Yeah, Biobak might be the one to know.

key_stories.title: Opening Beta Testing to the Public
key_stories.summary: Kaze launched a Google Form to recruit casual players for beta testing. He clarified expectations, avoided Patreon for legal reasons, and promised viewers first access.
key_stories.challenge: Need broad gameplay feedback without creating legal exposure.
key_stories.process: Created Google Form, announced on stream, explained criteria (casual play, not bug hunting).
key_stories.outcome: Beta application is live; selection ongoing; may make a wider announcement video later.
key_stories.key_quote: Right now I have this Google Form. If you guys want to beta test, you can fill it out… I don't want to get into any legal trouble here, so I don't want to look for testers on Patreon.

key_stories.title: Rediscovering the Crystal Path Star
key_stories.summary: While revisiting the Course 3 cave, Kaze realized he’d forgotten a planned star objective. With chat’s help, he recalled that carrying crystals should reveal a traversable path.
key_stories.challenge: Lost track of a previously conceived level mechanic.
key_stories.process: Searched old VODs, consulted chat, pieced together the original concept.
key_stories.outcome: Idea documented; implementation deferred until cave work resumes.
key_stories.key_quote: Oh, that's the idea… while you hold the crystal a path around Mario appears.

key_stories.title: Stuck Between Canada and the Finanzamt
key_stories.summary: Kaze described his unresolved German tax situation: he hired an accountant, believes he overpaid, but cannot confirm because the accountant won’t respond and cross-border calls are expensive.
key_stories.challenge: Managing German tax obligations from Canada with poor communication.
key_stories.process: Paid accountant, attempted contact, shared frustration on stream.
key_stories.outcome: Situation remains uncertain, contributing to personal stress.
key_stories.key_quote: I think I did everything right but I have no proof for it.

key_stories.title: Sponsorship-Driven Video Production
key_stories.summary: Kaze openly explained that Squarespace sponsorships fund his YouTube output, paying a flat $2,500, and that he likely wouldn’t make videos without this income.
key_stories.challenge: Securing income to support family while developing the game.
key_stories.process: Accepted flat-rate sponsorships, increased video frequency.
key_stories.outcome: Channel views rising; planning additional sponsored content and new sponsors.
key_stories.key_quote: I would not have made a single one of those videos if Squarespace didn't pay me.
